section: Company will use its best efforts to deliver the Client Website in the time frame specified in the Scope of Work. <*$p$*>Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018.
explanation: This section states that the company will use its best efforts to deliver the website within the timeframe specified in the scope of work and immediately after indicates what the terms of the project are. The project is set to be 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018 is more than 12 weeks, therefore the terms of the project are misaligned.

section: Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. <*$p$*>Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are subject to delay if Company does not receive the required materials or documentation in a timely manner or in the required format or if approvals are delayed by Client or if the Scope of Work is changed by Client.
explanation: This section introduces uncertainty by stating that due dates are subject to delay if the company does not recieve the required materials on time, if approvals are delayed by the client or if the scope of work is changed by the client. This undermines the set timeline. It creates ambiguity by allowing the project's terms to shift, making it difficult to hold the company accountable to the original 12-week plan, leading to potential disputes.

section: Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work. <*$p$*>3. Business Hours; Rush Work.
explanation: Section 2 speaks on the payment terms and right after, in Section 3, there is no transition to the business hours and rush work details. This structural flaw interrupts the flow of information and creates a disjointed reading experience.
